title: Something needs to happen with Lee Sin.
body: With the removal of trackers knife lee sin is essentially gutted. Does riot have any plans to fix this? I was thinking they could maybe make his w into a dash that applies a shield to allies or something, I just think it isn’t healthy for his kit to rely on wards in the first place. Any ideas?

replies.body:
It wouldn't be the first time that a champ in league was forgotten {{champion:26}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:266}}.

But I would say don't worry, Lee Sin has too big of a fan base for Riot to leave this champ dead, plus they can't just as you say "gut him" like that because Lee Sin is always played in LCS.

Lee needs to be forgotten. I'm sick of seeing his tired, bald ass in every competitive scene, so I'm perfectly fine if he rots in the gutters.
I don't care what his skill cap is, no champion should be as tanky as he is and deal as much damage as he's capable of with only 1 complete bruiser item, and then escape into the wilderness like nothing ever happened just because he pooped a ward. If they're making it harder for him to do things, then good. He has needed his balls clipped off for a long time.

I mean i'm not a fan of Lee either but jeez dude lol.

The only thing I hate most about him is his point to click kick.

That is different because I’m the LCS there is so much teamwork that a lee can cope with just the warding totem, in a game with a bunch of random people having 2 wards at a time with a high cooldown just won’t cur it in a average game of league.

Heaven forbid he isnt a strong pick for a few months

Honestly im glad he isnt played as often as he once was considering how oppressive junglers can be atm

Considering the ward is a free escape and gap closer it makes sense for them to leave things as is and see how things roll out for a few patches.  The skill floor just got raised for him and I'd be hard pressed to find less than a handful of people that think that's a good thing.
